slide.text: We commissioned seven solar PV projects in 2020. These solar PV projects have the capacity to generate almost 5 GWh of renewable energy annually.

slide.text: We have made great strides in reducing our carbon emissions to date. To meet the goal of limiting global warming to 1.5°C, compared to pre-industrial levels, we are targeting Net Zero manufacturing by 2030.
We upcycled 573 million PET waste plastic bottles into our manufacturing process an increase of almost 50% versus 2019.
Kingspan Water and Energy installed 8 rainwater harvesting systems in 4 countries with a total expected annual yield of over 2 million litres.

slider_info.slide_text_t:
Mafer
Solar installations at our Joris Ide facility in Mafer were doubled in 2020 to 500 kWp. 50% of Mafer’s electricity needs will now be generated on site.

Ansbach
In December 2020 we installed 750 kWp of rooftop solar panels at our Joris Ide facility in Ansbach.

Hille
Completed in December 2020, the solar installation at Hille is Joris Ide’s largest installation to date, with 1087 kWp.

slider_info.slide_desc: Kingspan Water and Energy installed a 20,000 litre rainwater tank
slider_info.slide_text_t:
Installed at its facility in Rokietnica, Poland, this tank is already delivering c.300 litres of rainwater daily.

A second tank is presently being fitted with plans for two more

The new tanks will be connected to Kingspan Access telemetry, providing a continuous feed of system information to the Kingspan Connect cloud-based platform. All tanks will be connected to the on-site sanitary facility.
slider_info.slide_img_text_two:
1.7 million litres annually
The tanks will have the capacity to harvest 1.25 – 1.7 million litres of rainwater annually
